Sentencas: Protonic ceramic fuel cells (PCFCs) composed of porous electrodes and dense electrolytes are considered to be a promising alternative to solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) at low and intermediate temperatures (<= 600 degrees C) due to their comparative low activity barrier.
Titulo: Microscopic Mechanism Study of 4f Electrons' Positive Effect on the Enhanced Proton Conduction in a Pr-Doped BaCeO3 Electrolyte

Sentencas: It is well known that rare earth elements, such as Y, Yb, and Pr, have been applied to dope prototypical perovskite-type oxides BaCeO3 and BaZrO3 to improve both the conductivity and the stability.
Titulo: Microscopic Mechanism Study of 4f Electrons' Positive Effect on the Enhanced Proton Conduction in a Pr-Doped BaCeO3 Electrolyte

Sentencas: In this article, we particularly select Pr with a radius similar to that of Ce as a dopant to dope BaCeO3, aiming to exclusively extract the 4f5d electrons' effect on the protonic conductivity as well as the influence on the stability, based on both a static density functional theory (DFT) calculation and an ab initio molecular dynamics (AIMD) simulation.
Titulo: Microscopic Mechanism Study of 4f Electrons' Positive Effect on the Enhanced Proton Conduction in a Pr-Doped BaCeO3 Electrolyte

Sentencas: The calculated results demonstrated that the oxygen vacancy formations were lowered owing to the O 2p band center shifting toward the Fermi level and the protonic conductivity was positively reduced due to the energy springboard provided by the Pr 4f orbital, and the p-type semiconductor effect originated from the different covalent states of Pr3+ with Ce4+.
Titulo: Microscopic Mechanism Study of 4f Electrons' Positive Effect on the Enhanced Proton Conduction in a Pr-Doped BaCeO3 Electrolyte

Sentencas: AIMD simulations confirmed the proton transition process as previously proposed and thermodynamic stability at a temperature as high as 750 degrees C.
Titulo: Microscopic Mechanism Study of 4f Electrons' Positive Effect on the Enhanced Proton Conduction in a Pr-Doped BaCeO3 Electrolyte

Sentencas: In contrast, CO2 and SO2 adsorption calculated results indicate that Pr doping has little effect on the chemical stability.
Titulo: Microscopic Mechanism Study of 4f Electrons' Positive Effect on the Enhanced Proton Conduction in a Pr-Doped BaCeO3 Electrolyte

Sentencas: This is consistent with the experimental strategy in which multiple rare earth elements are utilized to secure the high performance of the electrolytes in these acceptor-doped perovskites.
Titulo: Microscopic Mechanism Study of 4f Electrons' Positive Effect on the Enhanced Proton Conduction in a Pr-Doped BaCeO3 Electrolyte
